title.narrative: 3.1: VAC AND CCP

description.narrative: Knowledge, political will and resources leveraged for the elimination of violence against children, and tools developed for the country and communities to enhance awareness and an enabling environment for reporting, which contributes to Access To Justice, Birth Registration, Child Protection Systems, Child Protection â€“ Strengthen Families And Communities, Data And Child Protection, Justice For Children, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence, Violence, Exploitation And Abuse. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Girls and boys, especially the most vulnerable and those affected by humanitarian situations, are protected from all forms of violence, exploitation, abuse and harmful practices

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Knowledge, political will and resources leveraged for the elimination of violence against children, and tools developed for thecountry and communities to enhance awareness and an enabling environment for reporting

description.narrative: UNICEF provided critical support to the Presidency to address violence against children (VAC) together with civil society, academia and private sector, resulting in the country's integrated GBV National Strategic Plan (NSP), which tables integrated programmes on prevention and response to violence against women and children; it is managed and coordinated at the President's offices demonstrating political will and commitment to ending violence against women and children. Work with the religious sector on social mobilization on child protection and reporting mechanisms led to the formation of a network among religious groups in various provinces. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:17/01/2020
